name: GetSegmentMembersInfo
description:
Get information about members in a saved segment.

Use this tool to retrieve information about members within a specified segment. It is useful when you need details on who is part of a particular saved segment in a mailing list.

parameters.name: list_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID representing the mailing list from which the segment members will be retrieved. This ID is required to specify the context of the segment.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: segment_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the segment to retrieve members from.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the segment.

parameters.name: included_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of specific fields to return. Use dot notation for sub-object parameters.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: fields_to_exclude
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to exclude using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: records_to_return
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Default is 10; maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip for pagination purposes. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: include_cleaned_members
parameters.description: Specify 'true' to include cleaned (invalid or bounced) members in the response. Otherwise, specify 'false'.

parameters.name: include_transactional_members
parameters.description: Set to true to include transactional members in the response.

parameters.name: include_unsubscribed_members
parameters.description: Specify 'true' to include unsubscribed members in the response, 'false' to exclude them.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the list.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: segment_id
parameters.description: The unique id for the segment.

value_schema.description: The unique id for the segment.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
